main event: On September 18, 1966, an observer in New York City reported seeing a heavy object that appeared dimmer than the moon and moved intermittently, suggesting it might have been a balloon used for advertising.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 2 hours and exhibited variable illumination., The observer, a retired artist, claimed to have a keen observational ability., There were no other witnesses who could confirm the sighting., The object changed in brightness and appeared to move up and down., The document was part of Project Blue Book, collecting data on UFO sightings.
sighted object: a heavy object possibly resembling a balloon
location: New York City, New York, USA
witness description: retired artist with experience in graphic arts
